body_content.explanation: letters, numbers, or symbols that have been produced on paper by a machine using ink:
examples: The title is in bold print.
This novel is available in large print for readers with poor eyesight.
The book was rushed into print (= was produced and published) as quickly as possible.
The print quality (= the quality of the text produced) of the new laser printer is excellent.
The debate is still raging, both in print and online.

body_content.explanation: If a book is in print, it is possible to buy a new copy of it, and if it is out of print, it is not now possible:
examples: Is her work still in print?

body_content.explanation: a photographic copy of a painting, or a picture made by pressing paper onto a special surface covered in ink, or a single photograph from a film:
examples: I had some prints made of the party photos.

body_content.explanation: any type of pattern produced using ink on a piece of clothing:

examples: The burglar had left his prints all over the window.

body_content.explanation: to produce writing or images on paper or other material with a machine:
examples: The leaflets will be printed on recycled paper.
I'm waiting for a document to print.

body_content.explanation: to include a piece of writing in a newspaper or magazine:
examples: Some newspapers still refuse to print certain swear words.
They printed his letter in Tuesday's paper.

body_content.explanation: to produce a newspaper, magazine, or book in large quantities:
examples: 20,000 copies of the novel will be printed in hardback.

body_content.explanation: to write without joining the letters together:
examples: Please print your name clearly below your signature.

body_content.explanation: to produce a photograph on paper:
examples: Photographs are better if they are printed from the original negative.

body_content.explanation: to produce a pattern on material or paper:
examples: The designs are printed onto the fabric by hand.
